intro: Ceropegia leucotaenia, commonly known as the white-stemmed African violet, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and tubular flowers. The plant features succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a fine, white coating. Its flowers are typically pale green or white, with a distinctive shape that attracts specific pollinators. It is a popular ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of cultivation.
